Scenario.name: Real-time Assessment
Scenario.description:
This course is designed to provide an example of the GIFT/RIDE Integration.

This course contains a real-time assessment built for the "React to Fire (Forest)" scenario in RIDE.

This course is used to train a single user, and not designed for multiplayer.

This course one playable team member, four non-playable enemy team members, and an OC/T non-playable team member. You will be assessed on several tasks described throughout the real-time assessment, and reviewed in a slide show after the real-time assessment ends.

The real-time assessment will end 10 seconds after all enemies are eliminated.

Mission.Task: BATTLE DRILL 2A. Conduct a Squad Assault
Mission.Situation: This drill begins when the enemy initiates direct fire contact.
Mission.Goals: The squad locates and suppresses the enemy, establishes supporting fire, and assaults the enemy position using fire and maneuver. The squad destroys or causes the enemy to withdraw, conducts consolidation and reorganizes.
Mission.Condition: The squad is moving as part of the platoon conducting a movement to contact or an attack. The enemy initiates direct fire contact.
Mission.ROE: The squad locates and suppresses the enemy, establishes supporting fire, and assaults the enemy position using fire and maneuver. The squad destroys or causes the enemy to withdraw, conducts consolidation and reorganizes.

ns4:message.ns4:content: --1. Please READ these instructions carefully! When the scenario begins use the WASD, or the arrow keys, to move your player. To zoom into your weapon scope view, press and hold your right mouse button. Pressing ESC at anytime will bring up a full list of controls.
--2. The floating numbers in RIDE will serve as waypoints to trigger tasks throughout the scenario.
--3. Contact with an enemy force will initiate shortly after you reach Station 1. You will also find one of your teammates at Station 1, he will help you with your first task.
--4. You will be notified when you reach each Station with instructions. Check back here regularly for updates and information.

--5. If you have not already done so, press "Begin" in the RIDE window.

To show a weapon crosshair, weapon information, and health, press the "Tab" key.
--Now head to Station 1 to start your first task!

pointRef.value: Position of Dominance (Muzzle Flagging Task Trigger) [1]

ns4:message.ns4:content: --STATION 1: MUZZLE FLAGGING TASK STARTED

--To see the Muzzle Flagging automated assessment in action, use your mouse to swivel your player's Point of Aim until your weapon is directed at your near-by teammate (make sure you are not standing in front of him).
This will create a Below Expectation assessment using the Muzzle Flagging condition class.
--Please navigate to Station 2 to initiate the next task.
--Station 2 Complete! Please navigate to Station 3 to initiate the next task.
--Station 3 Complete! Please navigate to Station 4 to initiate the next task.

pointRef.value: FireTeam Rate of Fire Task Start Trigger [4]

StrategyApplied.strategyName: FireTeam Rate of Fire Above Expectation
FireTeam Rate of Fire At Expectation

ns4:message.ns4:content: --Station 4 Complete! Please navigate to Station 5 to initiate the final task in this example.

point.name: Position of Dominance (Muzzle Flagging Task Trigger) [1]
FireTeam Rate of Fire Task Start Trigger [4]

stateTransition.name: Learner Moved to Position of Dominance
FireTeam Rate of Fire Above Expectation

strategyRef.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire Above Expectation

stateTransition.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire At Expectation

strategyRef.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire At Expectation

stateTransition.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire Below Expectation

strategyRef.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire Below Expectation
How to Trigger Rate of Fire

ns4:message.ns4:content: --STATION 1: AVOID/REACH LOCATION TASK STARTED

--You have reached the designated location. This feedback is being sent to you because you came within 5 feet of the coordinates provided in GIFT's assessment logic. This task will now end. You will receive instructions for the next task in a few seconds.
--You have violated the Muzzle Flagging assessment by pointing your weapon towards your teammate. Point your weapon away from your teammate to maintain weapon safety.
--You are no longer violating the Muzzle Flagging condition. Station 1 is now complete.
--STATION 2: DETECT OBJECTS TASK STARTED
--Now that enemy contact has been initiated you will need to maintain situational awareness and detect all threats.

--To track how well you can detect the targets in your area, you will need to orient your focal view towards any identified entity. Through this condition class, we can assess how well you can identify potential threats in your immediate surroundings.

--Orienting the enemy into your 45 degree visual cone within 10 seconds will result in At Expectation performance.

--Orienting in less than 5 seconds will result in Above Expectation.

--Any time frame over 10 seconds will result in a below expectation performance assessment.
--The assessment will now begin. Good luck!
--Great job! You detected the enemy with an Above Expectation assessment based on the condition parameters. This means you placed the target in your primary field of view within 5 seconds.
--This task will now end. You will receive instructions for your next task in a few seconds.
--Good job! You detected the enemy with an At Expectation assessment based on condition parameters. This means you placed the target in your primary field of view within 10 seconds.
--This task will now end. You will receive instructions for your next task in a few seconds.
--You failed to detect the specified targets within a configured 10-second window, resulting in a Below Expectation assessment.
--This task will now end. You will receive instructions for your next task in a few seconds.
--STATION 3: ASSIGNED SECTOR TASK STARTED

--It is important to maintain visual coverage of your surrounding environments when in contact with the enemy.

Your sector of fire for this task covers 75 degrees from the center of the OPFORs location in the tree line. Try looking outside of your sector to trigger a change in assessment.
--The assessment will now begin. Good luck!
--Good job! You are properly maintaining eyes on your assigned sector of fire.
--This task will now end. You will receive instructions for your next task in a few seconds.
--Be careful! You are not maintaining appropriate vision your assigned sector. Adjust your orientation towards the proper area to correct your assessment.

strategy.name: How to Trigger Rate of Fire

ns4:message.ns4:content: --STATION 4: FIRETEAM RATE OF FIRE TASK STARTED
--While engaging an enemy, it is important to maintain a consistent rate of fire to suppress enemy movement.
--When the assessment begins, try firing your weapon at a very slow rate for about 25 seconds, then increasing the rate to see a change in assessment.
--The assessment will now begin. Good luck!

strategy.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire Above Expectation

ns4:message.ns4:content: --Great job! You are maintaining the proper rate of fire with Above Expectation performance.
--This task will now end. You will receive instructions for your next task in a few seconds.

strategy.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire At Expectation

ns4:message.ns4:content: --Good job! You are maintaining the proper rate of fire with At Expectation performance.
--This task will now end. You will receive instructions for your next task in a few seconds.

strategy.name: FireTeam Rate of Fire Below Expectation

ns4:message.ns4:content:
--You are NOT maintaining appropriate rate of fire. You are assessed at Below Expectation.
Pick up the rate to change your Assessment back to At Expectation.
--STATION 5: ENGAGE TARGETS TASK STARTED

--While in contact with an enemy, it is critical to react swiftly and accurately. In order to be assessed at engaging the targets above expectation, you will need to fire your weapon at the recognized enemy within 5 seconds of them entering your aiming field of view (e.g, 15 degrees).
--Firing your weapon within 10 seconds will result in at expectation performance. Any time frame over 10 seconds will result in a below expectation performance assessment.
--The assessment will now begin. Good luck!
--Good job! You engaged your targets with Above Expectation performance. This means you fired your weapon at the target in your field of view within 5 seconds.
--This task is now complete. The course will end when all four enemies have been neutralized.
--That's ok! You engaged your targets with At Expectation performance. This means you fired your weapon at the target in your field of view within 10 seconds.
--This task is now complete. The course will end when all four enemies have been neutralized.
--You did not engage the targets quick enough. This means you took longer than 10 seconds to fire your weapon at the target in your field of view.
--This task is now complete. The course will end when all four enemies have been neutralized.

--All enemies have been neutralized. Good job!
The RIDE scenario portion of this GIFT course is now complete. You will move on to the next portion of the course in a few seconds.
